Doolin is a small village located on the north west coast of

was just a typical Irish village, but then Irish folk music became more and more popular all around the world, and one of the best Irish whistle players, Micho Russell, lived in Doolin. During the times that he was not on US tour or in the studio, he could often be found at the O´Connor´s Pub in Doolin playing with his two brothers. This attracted an increasing number of tourists to the village, which in turn lead to more pubs offering Irish music sessions. Even though Micho Russel died in 1994, Doolin has retained its reputation as the unofficial "capital of Irish traditional music".

Although the village is full of tourists during summer, it is not like other tourist destinations in Ireland. People who go to Doolin do not just take a few photographs and move on, but get involved. They explore the local the culture and participate in the music scene. Consequently, the atmosphere is very friendly.

The village itself is just one street, Fisher Street. This is where most of the shops and pubs are located. Beyond that, there is a wide net of small roads that consists of the residential area. So, be aware that if you want to visit Doolin, due to the small population of the village and limited accommodation, you may find yourself staying 5 miles away.

Also note that there is NO ATM in Doolin village so come prepared!

content=Sea View House in Doolin village is the home of the Hughes Family. It is a unique and luxurious bed and breakfast superbly located in its own grounds on a hillside overlooking the Atlantic ocean, the Allie river and the beautiful Doolin countryside. Best of all, step outside the door and it's just a few hundred feet to the famous Gus O'Connor's Pub, famous for live traditional music sessions.
content=Bed and Breakfast located in Doolin, close to the Cliffs of Moher.

content=Paddy's Doolin Hostel is in the center of Doolin and within 10 minutes walking of all music pubs and restaurants, overlooking Fisherstreet, closest to the famous Gus O'Connors pub, the sea, Doolin Pier for trips to the aran Islands and the Cliffs of Moher cruises in season. The Cliffs start 250 meters from the door. Bus Eireann buses daily from the hostel. Doolin hostel is spacious has dormitory rooms up to 8 persons, but mostly private rooms with shower and toilet. There is a small shop on site, Bureau de Change, large fully equiped kitchen, dining room and sitting room.
content=Beautiful small hostel situated at the river, very friendly staff!

http://www.doolinbandb.com/ Fisher Lane (off Fisher Street), tel: +353 65 707-4673, email: fishermanrest@eircom.net. Quiet central location, good small but clean rooms with en suite bathrooms.  €30 per person with very good breakfast. Friendly colorful host.

content=Joan & Martin Reilly run a friendly, spacious B&B in centre of village. Prices from €33 per person, 6 options for breakfast.
content=Susan Daly operates a very nice, high quality B&B very near O'Connors Pub.
